001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline;
004import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiablePerson;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
011import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
013import io.github.ai4ci.util.ThreadSafeArray;
014
015/**
016 * High level template for constructing and initialising the simulation model.
017 *
018 * <p>
019 * This abstract builder defines the five staged model construction process used
020 * by the simulation: setup, baseline outbreak, baseline people, initialise
021 * outbreak and initialise people. Concrete subclasses supply the domain
022 * specific logic by implementing the abstract hook methods such as
023 * {@link #setupOutbreak(ModifiableOutbreak, SetupConfiguration, Sampler)} and
024 * {@link #initialisePerson(ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler)}.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Configuration driven behaviour: callers provide an instance of
028 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration} to
029 * {@link #doSetupOutbreak(ModifiableOutbreak, SetupConfiguration, Sampler)}.
030 * The common implementation in this class sets the configuration on the
031 * outbreak instance and allocates the people container from the outbreak's
032 * population size. Implementations should consult the following fields on the
033 * setup configuration when implementing hooks:
034 * <ul>
035 * <li>{@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#getInitialImports()}
036 * — suggested number of initial cases to seed when implementing seeding
037 * strategies.</li>
038 * <li>{@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()} —
039 * network topology and size options used when creating social structures; use
040 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#hilbertBits} or
041 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#getHilbertCoords(Integer)}
042 * for spatial placement where appropriate.</li>
043 * <li>{@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}
044 * — demographic configuration used to draw population age/sex strata or
045 * location aware demographic attributes during person baselining.</li>
046 * </ul>
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * Rationale and extension points: separating build stages makes the
050 * construction process robust and testable. Each stage performs a distinct
051 * responsibility so callers may validate preconditions before proceeding.
052 * Subclasses should implement the abstract hooks to provide domain logic. When
053 * writing hook implementations consider keeping them side effect free where
054 * practical (builders return constructed immutable baseline/state objects) and
055 * prefer to perform expensive IO or CPU work in the setup stage where it is
056 * obvious to parallelise or cache results.
057 *
058 * <p>
059 * Concurrency: the base class initialises a thread safe people container via
060 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.ThreadSafeArray}. Implementers that modify shared
061 * outbreak structures should ensure thread safety; for example by using local
062 * concurrent collections, synchronisation or by confining state mutation to a
063 * single thread during setup.
064 *
065 * <p>
066 * Downstream consumers of the produced objects include the state machine
067 * initialisers and runtime components such as
068 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonInitialiser} and the
069 * outbreak execution code which expect baselined outbreak and person objects
070 * before simulation starts.
071 *
072 * @author Rob Challen
073 */
074public abstract class AbstractModelBuilder {
075
076        /**
077         * Default constructor.
078         */
079        public AbstractModelBuilder() {}
080
081        /**
082         * Hook for producing outbreak baseline values.
083         *
084         * <p>
085         * Subclasses should populate the outbreak baseline builder with static
086         * parameters such as policy defaults, disease baseline parameters and any
087         * other non dynamic settings. Keep the method side effect free and return
088         * the built baseline.
089         *
090         * <p>
091         * Implementation tip: compute and cache aggregates derived from the setup
092         * configuration (for example age pyramids, contact matrices or network
093         * degree distributions) here to speed up per‑person baselining.
094         *
095         * @param builder  the baseline builder to populate
096         * @param outbreak the outbreak to base upon
097         * @param sampler  random sampler for any stochastic baseline choices
098         * @return the built outbreak baseline
099         */
100        public abstract ImmutableOutbreakBaseline baselineOutbreak(
101                        ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder builder, Outbreak outbreak,
102                        Sampler sampler
103        );
104
105        /**
106         * Hook for producing person baseline values.
107         *
108         * <p>
109         * Implementations should author non dynamic person attributes such as
110         * demographics, household membership and persistent behaviour settings.
111         * These baseline values are used later by the person initialiser to create
112         * runtime state.
113         *
114         * <p>
115         * Implementation tip: keep this method focused on stable attributes (that do
116         * not change at runtime). Any derived values needed for fast runtime
117         * initialisation can be precomputed here and stored in the baseline object.
118         *
119         * @param builder the person baseline builder to populate
120         * @param person  the target person instance
121         * @param rng     random sampler for any stochastic choices
122         * @return the built person baseline
123         */
124        public abstract ImmutablePersonBaseline baselinePerson(
125                        ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng
126        );
127
128        /**
129         * Perform outbreak baselining.
130         *
131         * <p>
132         * This method checks that prior stages have completed successfully (setup,
133         * execution configuration and social network) and that people have been
134         * baselined before delegating to
135         * {@link #baselineOutbreak(ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder, Outbreak, Sampler)}
136         * to populate outbreak level baseline parameters.
137         *
138         * <p>
139         * How configuration drives behaviour: the outbreak baseline should use
140         * demographic defaults from {@link SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}
141         * where population‑level priors are required. Network derived metrics
142         * available from {@link SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()} can be used to
143         * compute baseline contact rates or global transmission modifiers.
144         *
145         * <p>
146         * Extension guidance: implementers may cache computed aggregates (for
147         * example age distributions or contact matrices) here so that per‑person
148         * baselining can remain lightweight and possibly parallel.
149         *
150         * @param builder the outbreak baseline builder
151         * @param o       the outbreak to base
152         * @param sampler a random sampler used during baselining
153         * @return the completed outbreak baseline
154         * @throws RuntimeException if preconditions for baselining are not met
155         */
156        public ImmutableOutbreakBaseline doBaselineOutbreak(
157                        ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder builder, Outbreak o, Sampler sampler
158        ) {
159                if (o instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
160                        ModifiableOutbreak m = (ModifiableOutbreak) o;
161                        if (!m.getPeople().isEmpty() && m.initialisedSetupConfiguration()
162                                        && m.initialisedExecutionConfiguration()
163                                        && m.initialisedSocialNetwork()
164                                        && this.isBaselined(m.getPeople()))
165                                return this.baselineOutbreak(builder, o, sampler);
166                }
167                throw new RuntimeException(
168                                "Outbreak is not configured correctly for baselining."
169                );
170        }
171
172        /**
173         * Perform per-person baselining.
174         *
175         * <p>
176         * This method validates that the outbreak has been sufficiently prepared
177         * (setup, execution configuration and social network) before delegating to
178         * {@link #baselinePerson(ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, Person, Sampler)}
179         * which is expected to populate non dynamic person-level baseline parameters
180         * such as demographic attributes or behaviour defaults.
181         *
182         * <p>
183         * How configuration drives behaviour: implementers should use the outbreak's
184         * attached {@link SetupConfiguration} to derive individual demographic
185         * attributes (for example by sampling age/sex strata from
186         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}) and location assignment
187         * using {@link SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()} options.
188         *
189         * @param builder the person baseline builder
190         * @param p       the person to baseline
191         * @param sampler a random sampler used during baseline
192         * @return the completed person baseline
193         * @throws RuntimeException if preconditions for baselining are not met
194         */
195        public ImmutablePersonBaseline doBaselinePerson(
196                        ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder builder, Person p, Sampler sampler
197        ) {
198                // Filter only to people that have been fully initialised
199                if (p.getOutbreak() instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
200                        ModifiableOutbreak m = (ModifiableOutbreak) p.getOutbreak();
201                        if (m.initialisedSetupConfiguration()
202                                        && m.initialisedExecutionConfiguration()
203                                        && m.initialisedSocialNetwork())
204                                return this.baselinePerson(builder, p, sampler);
205                }
206                throw new RuntimeException(
207                                "Person is not configured correctly for baselining."
208                );
209        }
210
211        /**
212         * Perform outbreak initialisation.
213         *
214         * <p>
215         * After baselining this method checks that all required outbreak baseline
216         * and setup steps have been completed before delegating to
217         * {@link #initialiseOutbreak(ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder, Outbreak, Sampler)}
218         * to produce the runtime outbreak state used by the simulator.
219         *
220         * <p>
221         * How configuration drives behaviour: the initial outbreak state may
222         * incorporate global modifiers derived from {@link SetupConfiguration} (for
223         * example network scaling factors or demographic aggregates) which are
224         * typically computed during the baselining stage.
225         *
226         * @param builder the outbreak state builder
227         * @param o       the outbreak to initialise
228         * @param sampler a random sampler used during initialisation
229         * @return the initial outbreak state
230         * @throws RuntimeException if preconditions for initialisation are not met
231         */
232        public ImmutableOutbreakState doInitialiseOutbreak(
233                        ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder builder, Outbreak o, Sampler sampler
234        ) {
235                if (o instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
236                        ModifiableOutbreak m = (ModifiableOutbreak) o;
237                        if (m.initialisedBaseline() && m.initialisedSetupConfiguration()
238                                        && m.initialisedExecutionConfiguration()
239                                        && m.initialisedSocialNetwork())
240                                return this.initialiseOutbreak(builder, o, sampler);
241                }
242                throw new RuntimeException(
243                                "Outbreak is not configured correctly for initialisation."
244                );
245        }
246
247        /**
248         * Perform per-person initialisation.
249         *
250         * <p>
251         * This method ensures the person and its owning outbreak are properly
252         * baselined and configured and then delegates to
253         * {@link #initialisePerson(ImmutablePersonState.Builder, Person, Sampler)}
254         * to set the person's runtime state (for example infection state, immunity
255         * and other dynamic attributes). The implementation is the canonical place
256         * to convert baseline parameters into runtime values.
257         *
258         * <p>
259         * How configuration drives behaviour: initial values such as starting
260         * immunity or seeded infection timers should be derived from a combination
261         * of the person baseline and outbreak level configuration (for example
262         * lookups from {@link SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}). The person
263         * initialiser is responsible for converting baseline priors into the
264         * concrete numeric state used by runtime components.
265         *
266         * @param builder the person state builder
267         * @param p       the person to initialise
268         * @param sampler a random sampler used during initialisation
269         * @return the initial person state
270         * @throws RuntimeException if preconditions for initialisation are not met
271         */
272        public ImmutablePersonState doInitialisePerson(
273                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, Person p, Sampler sampler
274        ) {
275                if (p instanceof ModifiablePerson) {
276                        ModifiablePerson mp = (ModifiablePerson) p;
277                        if (p.getOutbreak() instanceof ModifiableOutbreak) {
278                                ModifiableOutbreak m = (ModifiableOutbreak) p.getOutbreak();
279                                if (mp.initialisedBaseline() && m.initialisedSetupConfiguration()
280                                                && m.initialisedExecutionConfiguration()
281                                                && m.initialisedSocialNetwork())
282                                        return this.initialisePerson(builder, p, sampler);
283                        }
284                }
285                throw new RuntimeException(
286                                "Person is not configured correctly for initialisation."
287                );
288        }
289
290        /**
291         * Perform initial outbreak setup.
292         *
293         * <p>
294         * This method performs the first stage of the build: it records the supplied
295         * {@link SetupConfiguration} on the outbreak, allocates the thread safe
296         * people container sized by the configured population, and then delegates to
297         * {@link #setupOutbreak(ModifiableOutbreak, SetupConfiguration, Sampler)}
298         * for domain specific setup (such as creating households, workplaces and
299         * seeding initial infections).
300         *
301         * <p>
302         * How configuration drives behaviour: implementers should read the
303         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getInitialImports()} value when deciding how
304         * many initial infections to add. Network topology and size should be
305         * derived from {@link SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()} and demographic
306         * defaults from {@link SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}.
307         *
308         * <p>
309         * Extension guidance: heavy IO or long running construction work is best
310         * performed inside the {@link #setupOutbreak} hook where callers can control
311         * parallelism. Keep this common method deterministic and fail early for
312         * invalid configurations.
313         *
314         * @param outbreak the modifiable outbreak instance to populate
315         * @param config   the setup configuration that drives topology and seeding
316         * @param sampler  a random sampler used for stochastic choices during setup
317         * @return the populated outbreak instance
318         * @throws RuntimeException if the configuration is null or invalid
319         */
320        public ModifiableOutbreak doSetupOutbreak(
321                        ModifiableOutbreak outbreak, SetupConfiguration config, Sampler sampler
322        ) {
323                if (config == null) throw new RuntimeException(
324                                "Outbreak is not configured correctly for setup."
325                );
326                outbreak.setSetupConfiguration(config);
327                outbreak.setPeople(
328                                new ThreadSafeArray<>(Person.class, outbreak.getPopulationSize())
329                );
330                return this.setupOutbreak(outbreak, config, sampler);
331        }
332
333        /**
334         * Hook for creating the initial outbreak runtime state.
335         *
336         * <p>
337         * Subclasses produce the outbreak state used by the simulator. This is where
338         * global runtime values that depend on the baselined outbreak are computed
339         * and stored. Keep the method side effect free other than producing the
340         * built state object.
341         *
342         * @param builder  the outbreak state builder to populate
343         * @param outbreak the outbreak to initialise
344         * @param sampler  a random sampler used during construction
345         * @return the initial outbreak state
346         */
347        public abstract ImmutableOutbreakState initialiseOutbreak(
348                        ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder builder, Outbreak outbreak,
349                        Sampler sampler
350        );
351
352        /**
353         * Hook for converting baseline values into a runtime person state.
354         *
355         * <p>
356         * Concrete builders should use this method to translate baseline attributes
357         * into the runtime state that will be used during simulation (for example
358         * initial infection timers, immunity levels and behaviour state). The method
359         * is the canonical place where baseline settings from
360         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration} and the baseline
361         * builders are combined to produce a person state.
362         *
363         * <p>
364         * Developer guidance: prefer idempotent transformations and avoid writing to
365         * shared mutable state from within this method; return the constructed
366         * {@code ImmutablePersonState} and let the caller attach it to the outbreak
367         * container.
368         *
369         * @param builder the runtime person state builder to populate
370         * @param person  the person to initialise
371         * @param rng     random sampler for stochastic initial values
372         * @return the initial person state
373         */
374        public abstract ImmutablePersonState initialisePerson(
375                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng
376        );
377
378        /**
379         * Helper that checks the people array for baseline initialisation.
380         *
381         * <p>
382         * Note: this is an implementation detail and is intentionally private.
383         */
384        private boolean isBaselined(ThreadSafeArray<Person> people) {
385                if (people.isEmpty()) return false;
386                return ((ModifiablePerson) people.get(0)).initialisedBaseline();
387        }
388
389        /**
390         * Hook for domain specific outbreak setup.
391         *
392         * <p>
393         * Concrete subclasses implement this method to create people, social
394         * structures and any other domain entities required by the simulation.
395         * Implementations should consult the supplied {@link SetupConfiguration}
396         * rather than external global state. The method returns the modified
397         * outbreak instance.
398         *
399         * <p>
400         * Suggested responsibilities for implementations:
401         * <ul>
402         * <li>Create persons and set baseline demographic placeholders or references
403         * to census data based on {@link SetupConfiguration#getDemographics()}.</li>
404         * <li>Construct social structures (households, workplaces) informed by
405         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getNetwork()} parameters.</li>
406         * <li>Seed initial infections using
407         * {@link SetupConfiguration#getInitialImports()} and any configured seeding
408         * strategy.</li>
409         * </ul>
410         *
411         * @param outbreak the modifiable outbreak to configure
412         * @param config   the setup configuration driving creation choices
413         * @param sampler  a random sampler for stochastic choices
414         * @return the configured outbreak instance
415         */
416        public abstract ModifiableOutbreak setupOutbreak(
417                        ModifiableOutbreak outbreak, SetupConfiguration config, Sampler sampler
418        );
419
420}
